data.profileText: a Representative from Mississippi; born in Berkeley County, Va., January 9, 1780; moved to Greenville, Miss.; served in the War of 1812 as major of Cavalry; distinguished himself at the Battle of New Orleans and was brevetted brigadier general for gallantry; unsuccessful candidate for Governor in 1820; elected as a Jacksonian candidate to the Twentieth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of William Haile, and reelected to the the succeeding Congress (October 21, 1828-March 3, 1831); died in Greenville, Miss., August 23, 1840.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by resignation of William Haile, and took his seat December 8, 1828.
